gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Honey Badger (Wave Glider) tracking data from the Automatic Identification Sensor (AIS) collected in the North Pacific gyre in 2015 (MAGI project)

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - Southwest Fisheries Science Center

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Honey Badger Wave Glider Tracking Data from AIS Dataset Description: <p>These&nbsp;data from the AIS (Automatic Identification Sensor)&nbsp;&nbsp;include&nbsp;latitude, longitude, speed over ground, rate of turn, and heading&nbsp;of&nbsp;the AUV Honey Badger (Wave Glider model V2). &nbsp;</p><p>For more information on project MAGI and a description of Honey Badger,&nbsp;see:&nbsp;<a href="http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/">http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/</a></p> Acquisition Description: <p>The AUV Honey Badger&nbsp;is a Wave GliderÂ® (model SV2)&nbsp;from Liquid Robotics. &nbsp;It was&nbsp;deployed from the Island of Hawai'i in May of 2015 as&nbsp;part of Mesoscale Features Aggregate Interactions (MAGI) project&nbsp;. The trackline is&nbsp;in the&nbsp;North Pacific Ocean and passes the ocean time-series station ALOHA.&nbsp;</p><p>For more information on project MAGI and a description of Honey Badger,&nbsp;see:&nbsp;<a href="http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/">http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1430048 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1430048

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Marine Science Institute and Dept. of Marine Science 750 Channel View Dr.

If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Long Duration AUVs as tools to explore Mesoscale feature aggregate interactions (MAGI)

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: Long Duration AUVs as tools to explore Mesoscale feature aggregate interactions (MAGI)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Description from NSF award abstract:Remote areas of the ocean are difficult to sample for short-lived or episodic features. This project will use a new sampling platform, the Wave Glider, and provide a continuous presence in the central North Pacific gyre. The six month duration of the mission will allow repeated sampling as well as spatial coverage previously unavailable. This mission will incorporate phytoplankton specific sensors as well as a set of optical sensors that will provide information on distribution, physiology and aggregation of a unique diatom-nitrogen fixing cyanobacterium symbiosis. When completed, this program will have generated the first data sets that follow these diatom blooms over extended periods in the region. Access to this instrumentation was facilitated by the PacX challenge, an international competition to produce high quality research from long-duration autonomous vehicles in the North and South Pacific Ocean. As a result of winning that competition, the principal investigator has been awarded the use of 6 months of the Honey Badger Wave Glider time in 2014. The Wave Glider is a wave-powered surface vessel capable of extended duration missions. In order to maximize this the principal investigator will outfit the glider with advanced sensors to quantify zones of intense diatom activity and aggregation along mesoscale features in the Pacific (Project MAGI: Mesoscale feature-AGregate Interactions).Note: This project is funded by an NSF RAPID award.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: BCO-DMO catalogue of parameters from Honey Badger (Wave Glider) tracking data from the Automatic Identification Sensor (AIS) collected in the North Pacific gyre in 2015 (MAGI project)

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653483.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: unitless Description: Time (UTC) in format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653484.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653485.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude; west is negative http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653486.rdf Name: COG Units: degrees Description: Course over ground http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653487.rdf Name: SOG Units: knots Description: Speed over ground http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653488.rdf Name: ROT Units: degrees per minute Description: Rotational velocity (rate of turn) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/653489.rdf Name: Heading Units: degrees Description: Heading

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Time (UTC) in format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude; west is negative; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Course over ground; General Description: Course over the ground
PI-supplied Description: Speed over ground; General Description: Speed over ground. Part of ship supplied along track data.

PI-supplied Description: Rotational velocity (rate of turn); General Description: Rotational velocity (angular velocity). Â Often used to describe theÂ rate of a turn of a vehicle or glider.Units can vary but are degrees per unit time such as degrees per minute or degrees per second.
PI-supplied Description: Heading; General Description: ship's heading, in degrees

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>The AUV Honey Badger&nbsp;is a Wave GliderÂ® (model SV2)&nbsp;from Liquid Robotics. &nbsp;It was&nbsp;deployed from the Island of Hawai'i in May of 2015 as&nbsp;part of Mesoscale Features Aggregate Interactions (MAGI) project&nbsp;. The trackline is&nbsp;in the&nbsp;North Pacific Ocean and passes the ocean time-series station ALOHA.&nbsp;</p><p>For more information on project MAGI and a description of Honey Badger,&nbsp;see:&nbsp;<a href="http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/">http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>These data are&nbsp;raw telemetry data obtained through the Wave Glider management system at Liquid Robotics, International.</p><p>For more information about this softare please see the Liquid Robotics Software Page:</p><p><a href="http://www.liquid-robotics.com/platform/software/">http://www.liquid-robotics.com/platform/software/</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>DMO notes:</p><ul><li>Latitude and longitude were rounded to 5 decimal places from 12.</li><li>Values of "NaN" and "nan" changed to "nd"</li></ul>

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: AIS Instrument Name: Automatic Identification Sensor Instrument Short Name:AIS Instrument Description: Automatic tracking system used on ships and by vessel traffic services (VTS) for identifying and locating vessels by electronically exchanging data with other nearby ships, AIS base stations, and satellites.
